content: Light Cruisers have relatively high Anti-Air defenses.
Normal Battleships have high Firepower but move slowly...
If you manually aim your battleships' guns and land a bullseye, damage will be increased by 20%!
Use your carrier's air support to clear the screen of all enemy shells!
Shield-type skills can only block smaller ammo and cannot block shells from main guns, torpedoes, or aircraft attacks.
Your fighters will automatically intercept enemy aircraft, but are limited by a cooldown timer.
Anti-air guns attack all enemies within range and deal damage shared across the hit enemy aircraft.
Enemy ships and aircraft that penetrate your vanguard's defensive line (left side of the screen) will attack and deal damage to your main fleet.
Most battleships come equipped with a 140mm Secondary Gun.
Large ships have more auxiliary defenses. Be careful when launching torpedoes from close range!
Can't get through enemy defenses? Try using torpedoes and dive bombers to deal with large ships.
AP weapons can deal large amounts of DMG to heavy ships.
Use high explosive ammo for a chance to set enemy ships on fire.
Identical skills don't stack. Higher level skills have priority over lower level skills.
Fire another round of high explosive ammo after setting a target on fire to keep it burning for more damage!
Did you know that you can change your flagship while preparing for battle?
Single line increases damage, reduces evasion. Double line increases evasion, reduces damage. Circular is balanced and improves Anti-Air.
You choose whether or not to display custom ship names in 'Settings - Notifications - Other'.
Auto battle unlocks once you have cleared stage 1-3.
Merit you earn from exercises may be exchanged for various rewards in the Merit Shop.
There are three types of skills: Offensive (red), Defensive (blue), and Support (yellow).
The comfort level in the dorm is determined by the furniture and decorations you have collected.
Cargo ships only appear on the battlefield for a short amount of time. Make sure not to miss them!
Your ships will only earn 50% EXP if you send them to battle while their moods are low.
